content.question:
For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

A student determines the mass percent of iron in a sample of iron ore by doing a redox titration. The student finds the mass of the sample and then dissolves it in acid to a total volume of <math alttext="25.00 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Using a buret, the student titrates the <math alttext="25.00 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> solution with <math alttext="0.017 molar K 2 C r 2 O 7 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.017</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>Cr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The following reaction occurs during the titration.

<math alttext="C r 2 O 7 with a negative 2 charge, aqueous, plus 6 F e with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 14 H with a positive one charge, aqueous, react to produce 2 C r with a positive 3 charge, aqueous, plus 6 F e with a positive 3 charge, aqueous, plus 7 H 2 O, liquid" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>Cr</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><msup><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>7</mn></msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msup><mtext>Fe</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>14</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msup><mtext>H</mtext><mo>+</mo></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msup><mtext>Cr</mtext><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msup><mtext>Fe</mtext><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext></math>

The student collects the following data.

Mass of iron ore in original sample
 <math alttext="0.36 gram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.36</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Buret reading at end point
 <math alttext="45.52 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>45.52</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Initial buret reading
 <math alttext="15.05 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15.05</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

(a) How many moles of <math alttext="F e with a positive 2 charge, aqueous " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> reacted with the <math alttext="C r 2 O 7 with a negative 2 charge, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></math> ?

frqParts.text:
For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

A student determines the mass percent of iron in a sample of iron ore by doing a redox titration. The student finds the mass of the sample and then dissolves it in acid to a total volume of <math alttext="25.00 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Using a buret, the student titrates the <math alttext="25.00 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> solution with <math alttext="0.017 molar K 2 C r 2 O 7 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.017</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>Cr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The following reaction occurs during the titration.

<math alttext="C r 2 O 7 with a negative 2 charge, aqueous, plus 6 F e with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 14 H with a positive one charge, aqueous, react to produce 2 C r with a positive 3 charge, aqueous, plus 6 F e with a positive 3 charge, aqueous, plus 7 H 2 O, liquid" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>Cr</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><msup><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>7</mn></msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msup><mtext>Fe</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>14</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msup><mtext>H</mtext><mo>+</mo></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msup><mtext>Cr</mtext><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msup><mtext>Fe</mtext><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext></math>

The student collects the following data.

Mass of iron ore in original sample
 <math alttext="0.36 gram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.36</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Buret reading at end point
 <math alttext="45.52 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>45.52</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Initial buret reading
 <math alttext="15.05 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15.05</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

(a) How many moles of <math alttext="F e with a positive 2 charge, aqueous " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> reacted with the <math alttext="C r 2 O 7 with a negative 2 charge, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></math> ?

(b) Assuming that all the iron in the ore was <math alttext="F e with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, calculate the mass percent of iron in the ore sample.

(c) The student learns that the actual mass percent of iron in the ore sample is greater than the experimental value calculated in part (b). The student claims that the difference between the actual and experimental values could have been caused by rinsing the buret with distilled water just prior to filling it with <math alttext="0.017 molar K 2 C r 2 O 7, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.017</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>Cr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Do you agree with the student's claim? Explain your reasoning.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
